newsitem.title: USA: ROC Communities sets rights plan.
newsitem.headline: ROC Communities sets rights plan.

text.p: ROC Communities Inc said its board of directors adopted a stockholder rights plan to assure that shareholders are treated fairly if there is a takeover attempt.
The preferred stock purchase rights will be distributed as a dividend at the rate of one right for each share of common stock held as of the close of business on September 30, 1996, the company said.
ROC Communities said earlier today that it agreed to an amended merger terms with Chateau Properties Inc.

The rights will be exercisable only if a person or group acquires ownership of 15 percent or more of the company's stock or a tender or exchange offer is announced for that size of a stake in ROC, the company said.

The rights plan permits a majority of the independent directors of ROC to reduce the common stock ownership threshold to 10 percent, if they determine an investor has intentions that are believed to be adverse to the company and shareholder interests.
ROC also said it has amended its bylaws to increase the percentage number of shares required to be held by stockholders of ROC to call a special meeting to 50 percent from 10 percent.
ROC said its rights plan is not a response to any particular takeover threat.
